subject: Parenting
title: Adapting to the Child
description: A micro-lesson that makes Adapting to the Child usable.

hook.text: One sibling thrives with strict structure. The other wilts under it. Same parents, opposite needs.

buildup.text: Children are born with different temperaments â€” some cautious, some bold, some sensitive.

discovery.text: Thomas and Chess identified nine temperament dimensions in the 1950s, all present from birth.

twist.text: A parenting style that works beautifully for one child can damage another in the same family.

climax.text: The best parents adjust their approach to fit each child's temperament â€” not the reverse.

punchline.text: The child tells you what they need, if you listen.

quiz.question: Who identified the nine dimensions of child temperament?
